item.title: The history of Black August involves advocacy for Black people...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

The history of Black August involves advocacy for Black people who are incarcerated due to the prison industrial complex and political activism for Black people. We continue to in this movement as Black people are both overrepresented in terms of cases of COVID-19 and in correctional settings. This week we are partnering with ACLU of Colorado and Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence (CAAPV) to demand decarceration.

"A prison sentence should not be a death sentence, but... that is precisely the fate that our panelists fear for their loved ones. Among others, hear from Amber Johnson, the daughter of Ronald Johnson. Mr. Johnson is a 62-year-old grandfather who relies on an inhaler to breathe. He has turned his life around in prison after being convicted of non-violent offenses related to substance abuse, but he is still years away from release.

Panelists will also include attorneys involved in the lawsuit against the Colorado Department of Corrections and Governor Polis for their failure to protect our vulnerable, incarcerated neighbors from COVID-19. There are hundreds of medically vulnerable, sick or elderly prisoners who pose no threat to public safety, but who face a serious risk of dying of COVID-19 in Colorado’s overcrowded prisons. Join us to decarcerate and save lives."

https://www.facebook.com/acluofcolorado/posts/3478847435482054

See More

WED, AUG 26

Covid-19 Decarceration Panel

Online EventCauses · 155 people

item.title: “Who is Ishmael Salaam to you? Many may have their own...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“Who is Ishmael Salaam to you? Many may have their own opinions and perceptions of who he really is. To me this man is a survivor, brother, father, and role model! How could one person endure so many battles and still stand tall ready to fight whatever comes their way? At 12-13 I struggled being home with my mom due to financial disadvantages leaving me and my sister with nowhere to go or no one to turn to. Ishmael stepped in with the little he had to offer us and made the be...st of it. He made sure he picked us up whenever he felt we tried to slack off by uplifting us with his goofy ways, picking us up and dropping us off at school, and even feeding us when he could barely feed himself. Fast forward years later to him becoming a man and having a beautiful daughter named Ishanti. For a couple of years of her life he was away, but the way he stepped up as a father was not shocking to me I knew his capabilities and god knew them as well. Second time around god blesses him again with another beautiful baby girl Isharri and as he tries his hardest to do right the enemy just couldn't help trying to assassinate his character. Ishmael Salaam was then arrested and convicted life without the possibility of parole plus 100 years for a incident he did not oversee nor was he there. Gwinnett county sentenced him without the proper evidence to prosecute him for this incident! How can our black men rise when society continues to paint our men out as monsters ? How can they sentence pedophiles, molesters, rapists, and kidnappers less time with the eligibility of parole? The system is designed to break up our homes leaving single mothers alone to raise kids on their own. It makes it harder for the people who want to do right and have a second chance at life to even find jobs. Months down the line August 20th, 2020 Ishmael lost the mother of his kids to a battle most people fight on the daily known as "Depression". Mashelle committed suicide leaving their kids without the comfort of a Mothers touch or a Father's touch. They need their father more than we can imagine regardless of who is actually there with them right now no one can fill that void or their hurt like he can. SO AGAIN who is Ishmael salaam to me ? ISHMAEL is a King, a survivor, a father, a brother, a grandson, a hero to some, a shadow, a soldier, a giver, a fighter, and a courageous BLACK MAN . PLEASE help me to help him get home to his kids !! If we stand for nothing we are able to fall for anything.” #blackinmatesmatter
https://www.ipetitions.com/petition/bring-ish-home

See MoreBRING ISH HOME 1357 people have signed this petition. Add your name now! Wisdom Moore 577 Comments 1357 people have signed. Your voice needed! item.title: #justiceforElijahMcClain #JusticeNOW
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#justiceforElijahMcClain #JusticeNOW

Celestial Alegría

It has been 365 days since Elijah McClain was murdered by Aurora Police officers- Nathan Woodyard, Jason Rosenblatt and Randy Roedema.

There have been 5 invest...igations, 1 civil rights law suit and 0 accountability! None of the officers responsible for Elijah’s death have been fired or charged.

We call upon Gov Jared Polis, Attorney General Phil Weiser, Aurora City Mayor Mike Coffman and Aurora City Attorney Daniel Brotzman to effectively use their decision making power to bring justice for Elijah McClain!

#JusticeForElijahMcClain
#BLM #FillTheirFeed #VoicesForElijah #LettersForElijah

item.title: As thousands of people again descend on Washington DC to...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

As thousands of people again descend on Washington DC to commemorate the March on Washington, #BlackLivesMatterDC is holding space for the families of those killed by state violence in the DC area. These loved ones are too often erased, forgotten and unknown and as a result not uplifted during national actions held here in DC. As part of our Black August events, we are bringing together the families of Black lives taken by the state during this virtual vigil.

A small group of... family members will come together in person for this very special vigil. We know that the Black community particularly in DC has been disproportionately impacted by COVID-19. Therefore we are limiting the in-person attendees and are excited that the vigil will be live streamed. In this way, thousands of people will be able to send their love and support to these families by uplifting the names of their loved ones. We will be live streaming from our Facebook page and we will update people closer to the event on the other ways to watch.

RSVP to receive updates about how you can volunteer and/or watch. https://tinyurl.com/DC-ANCESTORS

#NANMOW2020 #BlackLivesMatter #BlackLivesMatterDC #BlackLivesMatter #DCProtests #DCProtestors #AncestorsWatching #StopMPD #DefundMPD #DefundDCPolice #DefundDCPolice #DefundDPD #DefundAPD #DEFUNDPOLICE #DEFENDBLACKLIFE

See More

THU, AUG 27 AT 6:30 PM EDT

Ancestors Watching Vigil for Black Lives Lost to State Violence

Causes · 1,515 people

“As we fight for Justice and understanding, our family has and will face many trials during this time. Jacob Blake is a loving father of 6 that deserves proper medical attention and legal representation. We are looking to raise funds to supplement the moral support and prayers we have been receiving. These funds will go toward Jacob’s medical bills, legal representation, support for his children and therapy costs. This is the only official go fund me created by the family of Jacob Blake.”
#JacobBlake #BlackLivesMatter #Reparations

item.title: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching...
item.content:encoded: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching and reading about any violence enacted on our friends and loved ones, pieces of ourselves, on the internet. We give thanks to the ancestors and higher power that guided #JacobBlake back to share more joyful moments with his children like the one in this picture we are intentionally sharing instead of that horrific video. Today we are reminded that it is an essential component of #Blackliberation to take pause and hold space for our whole selves —body, mind, and spirit. To choose healing. #Blackhealingisrevolutionary #BlackLivesMatter
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

To Indy With Love is in Indianapolis, Indiana.

There is another viral trauma video. Here is a 5 sec guide for Black chronic trauma survivors.

Do not despair: Black healers are actively [re] making our pre-c...olonial trauma safe spaces to thrive. You are loved. Your existence is affirmed. You are worthy.

- Mishara : Communal Wellness Therapist, Black Healer & all that jazz...

#toindywithlove #therapist #coach #BlackHealer #community #mentalheath #socialandemotionalhealth #gather #play #feel #heal⁣⁣⁣

item.title: On August 5th, 2020, Djibril Diol, Adja Diol, Khadija Diol,...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

On August 5th, 2020, Djibril Diol, Adja Diol, Khadija Diol, Hassan Diol (Djibril's sister), and Hawa Baye (Hassan's infant daughter) were victims of an intentional arson of their home. Their Denver home was set on fire by an unknown perpetrator at 2:30 A.M. 3 adults inside were able to escape with no life-threatening injuries, but the 5 aforementioned individuals were killed.
The Denver police department is offering a $14,000 reward for information leading to the arrest of th...e killer, and the department is actively investigating the case as an arson. The Denver police have said they will not move forward with labeling this as a hate crime as they "do not want to narrow the scope of the investigation."
This petition has been created to raise awareness of what has happened to the Diol family, as the media coverage has been severely lacking. We are demanding the Denver police department increase their focus on this case and that they do not let up until their killer has been arrested, charged, and convicted. The continued trend of police departments undervaluing the lives of BIPOC individuals and failing to hold their murderers accountable must end now. Share this petition as much as possible to ensure the Diol family gets the justice they so desperately deserve.

GOFUNDME LINK IN COMMENTS to support the family with funeral expenses and basic necessities.

https://www.change.org/p/jared-polis-justice-for-the-diol-f…

See MoreJustice for the Diol Family

change.org

Sign the Petition

Justice for the Diol FamilyJustice for the Diol Family

item.title: From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what...
item.content:encoded:
From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what we celebrate today as #BlackAugust. Black August, first commemorated by our incarcerated brothers and sisters, is a time to recommit ourselves to the struggle for #BlackLiberation and to honor those who’ve contributed to our collective progress and all those who have been lost to unjust violence and systemic racism.
This August 21, join us in a car protest to bring the Black August fight to our local prison walls. We will drive in a mobile protest to the Denver County Jail and the GEO Aurora ICE detention facility to let those who are chained there know that we are with them, we are fighting for them, and we will keep fighting until all chains are broken.
The many injustices faced by those behind bars in the U.S. are today amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prisons and jails all across the country, where medical neglect is commonplace and quarantining impossible, have become hotspots of infection. Hundreds have died in US prisons from COVID-19, and yet no response has been made to defend against unnecessary death. The mass incarceration of Black, Brown, and Indigenous populations means that they are not only disproportionately affected by the virus outside of jail, but inside as well.
We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:
1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.
2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.
3. Free all political prisoners!
#FreeThemAll #DecarcerateNOW #decarcerateCOVID19

item.title: Known as this country’s “second Independence Day," "Black Independence Day," or "Black Liberation Day," #Juneteenth...
item.content:encoded:
Known as this country’s “second Independence Day," "Black Independence Day," or "Black Liberation Day," #Juneteenth celebrates the freedom of enslaved people at the end of the Civil War on June 19, 1865--two years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation when enslaved people in Galveston, Texas learned of their freedom.

Come celebrate with BLM 5280 at our Juneteenth Freedom Day Party! We will celebrate at “The Tree” (the site of BLM 5280's 2016 135-hour vigil) located across from the City & County Building at 14th Ave & Bannock. Please be advised that parking in that area is limited and/or currently blocked off.
From 10am-12pm, we will have FREE #COVID-19 testing on-site for everyone, regardless of their insurance or immigration status. Results will be available within 3-5 business days. In addition, resources (water, PPE, hand sanitizer, sunscreen) will be available at our new BLM 5280 Action Hub. We will be encouraging social distancing at this event.

Beginning at 12pm, there will be music (with special guests Brothers of Brass and DJ Big Styles!), food, arts, wellness activities, and celebrations of Black love and liberation throughout the day.
Can't attend, but looking to donate? Venmo @blm5280
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...

item.title: PSA: If Respectability hasn't gotten any of us free in the last few centuries you can be damn sure it ain't gonna get us free today. Pass it on.

item.title: For #NigelShelby 💔 “The teachings of the Man Box not only lay the foundation for violence and discrimination against women and girls to persist, but it shortens men’s life spans and increases men’s suicide rate.” acalltomen.org/a-call-to-men-…

item.title: Shameful. #CBWPA sharing this in big letters as if it’s something to be proud of. Colorado Black Women for Political Action- what action are you taking to protect the unhoused Black Women that you are voting to criminalize? #YESon300 facebook.com/story.php?stor…

item.title: It’s hard to celebrate 4/20 when so many people of color are still being arrested for pot. We have to do better. Learn more: benjerrys.co/2Xn8vr2 pic.twitter.com/fLsngGteOF
